item.title: Comment on zero-config WiFi gadget by Stefano
item.dc:creator: Stefano
item.description: Interesting solution, set in this mode the wifi is really comfortable. Thank you!
item.content:encoded: Interesting solution, set in this mode the wifi is really comfortable. Thank you!

item.title: Comment on How To Bypass Internet Censorship by Akash
item.dc:creator: Akash
item.description: I've been using Primovpn http://www.clearvpn.net/ for the past 2 years on their dual UK and US plan (switching between the 2 countries is easy simply a click to disconnect from one and connect to the other). They use OpenVPN and I have been able to watch iplayer and netflix without issue from the middle east where I am based. It's very easy to use.
item.content:encoded: I’ve been using Primovpn http://www.clearvpn.net/ for the past 2 years on their dual UK and US plan (switching between the 2 countries is easy simply a click to disconnect from one and connect to the other). They use OpenVPN and I have been able to watch iplayer and netflix without issue from the middle east where I am based. It’s very easy to use.

item.title: Comment on Chillispot Howto by aries
item.dc:creator: aries
item.description:
> Chillispot then sets up a DHCP server (this can be disabled from the chillispot conf file) on the tun0 interface.
How to disable the DHCP server provided by chillispot ?
item.content:encoded:
> Chillispot then sets up a DHCP server (this can be disabled from the chillispot conf file) on the tun0 interface.

item.title: Comment on How To Bypass Internet Censorship by Frederick Yamoah
item.dc:creator: Frederick Yamoah
item.description: Hello hackers, your-freedom though is working in Ghana, i think we have to work harder and find new tricks to bypass the restrictions that is preventing us from surfing the net. have make some new discovery but i want to try if for a month before pubblishing it, work hard and let surf forever.
item.content:encoded: Hello hackers, your-freedom though is working in Ghana, i think we have to work harder and find new tricks to bypass the restrictions that is preventing us from surfing the net. have make some new discovery but i want to try if for a month before pubblishing it, work hard and let surf forever.

item.title: Comment on Chillispot Howto by Gunther
item.dc:creator: Gunther
item.description: I found the file in the old repos from Ubuntu server 8.04. Download the source files for freeradius ( any version before 2 should have it ) and it would be in there.
item.content:encoded: I found the file in the old repos from Ubuntu server 8.04. Download the source files for freeradius ( any version before 2 should have it ) and it would be in there.

item.title: Comment on Chillispot Howto by Gunther
item.dc:creator: Gunther
item.description:
Hi, I have been trying for the past week or so to get chillispot working but have come stuck at the point where you propergate database with tables created by the maker's of freeradius.
Suppose to run the comand: zcat /usr/share/doc/freeradius/examples/mysql.sql.gz | mysql -u root -p radius
Each time I try it it say the .gz file does not exist. Which is true and I have so far been unable to find it.
Using ubuntu 9.04 Sever and stuck
Pleaaaase help!!
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I have been trying for the past week or so to get chillispot working but have come stuck at the point where you propergate database with tables created by the maker’s of freeradius.

Suppose to run the comand:
zcat /usr/share/doc/freeradius/examples/mysql.sql.gz | mysql -u root -p radius

Each time I try it it say the .gz file does not exist. Which is true and I have so far been unable to find it.

Using ubuntu 9.04 Sever and stuck

Pleaaaase help!!
